message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it deals with Natural Language Processing and Information Retrieval. The paper also mentions the use of a Convolutional Neural Network, which is a popular technique in the field of NLP. 

The paper could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it deals with document modelling tasks. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely as the paper mentions the use of a neural network to learn and compose features. 

The sub-category of Computer Vision (cs.CV) is also possible as the paper mentions a visualisation technique inspired by recent advances in visualising deep convolution networks for computer vision. 

Finally, the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also possible as the paper deals with a model that is able to represent the meaning of documents by embedding them in a low dimensional vector space, which is a common technique in AI.
